meanings.definition: An area or region with distinct characteristics or purposes.
meanings.sent1: The playground is one of the fun zones in the park.
meanings.sent2: She explored the different zones of the museum, each showcasing a different era.
meanings.sent3: The quiet zone in the library is where you can read without any noise.
meanings.sent4: Her mind wandered into the creativity zone, where ideas flowed freely.
meanings.sent5: The danger zone of the forest was marked with warning signs.

meanings.definition: A specific area designated for a particular use or activity.
meanings.sent1: The kitchen is the cooking zone of the house.
meanings.sent2: The parking zone near the entrance is reserved for guests.
meanings.sent3: The relaxation zone in the spa had soothing music and dim lights.
meanings.sent4: His room became a study zone with books scattered everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The play zone at the park was filled with laughter and joy.

meanings.definition: To divide into specific areas or regions.
meanings.sent1: She zones the garden by planting flowers in different sections.
meanings.sent2: The city council decided to zone the land for residential use.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally zoned his paper into separate sections for each subject.
meanings.sent4: The architect zoned the building into offices and common areas.
meanings.sent5: The teacher zoned the classroom for group activities and individual work.
